column4: I've got an Ubuntu Edgy box one which the gnome menus at the top and bottom are not responding (although strangely the icons in the "tray" at the top right are responding). Is there any sort of keystroke that will bring up something that allows me to kill the non-responding panel app? In windows I'd either use ctrl-alt-del to bring up taskman or use ctrl-esc to do the same. What is the equivalent on Ubuntu? I guess I'd prefer not to do ctrl-del or ctrl-
you can restart the gnome panel with "killall gnome-panel"
How do I issue the command killall ? That's my problem you see
if you cant get a terminal, you could go to ctrl+alt+f1, login and type that (ctrl+alt+f7 gets you back in x windows)
So how do I get to a terminal if gnome-panel isn't working?
maybe with alt+f2 (or what i said earlier)
Is there any GUI way of doing that
It's my wife's computer and she's not really used to doing command line stuff
you can start gnome-terminal with alt+f2 ?
well, you could allso try alt+f2, type xkill and then select the gnome panel with the skull...
Tried alt-F2 but nothing happens. I guess whatever was watching for that has hung
ah ok, then your best bet is virtual terminal, ctrl+alt+f1
Cheers. It's not ideal. Hopefully there'll be something much better in Fiesty
and that would be ?
The ideal UI would be something more like Windows that doesn't require a command line to fix things when the shell dies/hangs.
what ? i thought the gui freezed... as alt+f2 didnt work anymore...

so, if in ms-windows the gui freezed (ctrl+alt+del) doesnt work, you can only restart... on ubuntu you can go to ctrl+alt+f1 and do something for the console... so, cli rules over gui ;)
ctrl-alt-del always works. It is a hotkey that is not managed by the shell

and as long computers are programmed with _text_, text based "rescue" will win!
